channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Width restriction pulled out of ground, 2nd July
item.description:
Unsure if potholes was the correct option but a van has collided with the width restriction on friendly street ripping it out of the ground and knocking down road signage. The van is currently blocking the exit causing unsafe road usage

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26, Friendly Street, New Cross, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bins along Thames path, 2nd July
item.description:
Please empty bins more often in the summer. With the good weather and more traffic, collecting bins once every fortnight gets to the current state where rubbish overflows the bins. It smells and is visually unpleasant. The winds spread the contents in the surrounding area, just awful.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Erebus Drive, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter overflowing, 2nd July
item.description:
Litter bins are overflowing, smelling really badly and it hasn't been emptied for days (even after the weekend). Rubbish is being scattered further by the wind from the overflowing bins. This is a concern for health and safety.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Highbridge Wharf, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Its the pavement near Malorees School, 2nd July
item.description:
I am writing to bring your attention to a serious safety concern regarding the condition of the pavement in Christchurch Ave, London NW6 7PB. The surface is extremely uneven, posing a significant tripping hazard for pedestrians. This is especially dangerous for elderly individuals, children, and those with mobility challenges. Additionally, the current state of the pavement makes it very difficult or even impossible for wheelchair users or people using mobility aids to navigate safely. In many cases, they are forced to use the road instead, which increases the risk of accidents.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Christchurch Avenue, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damage to traffic lights, 2nd July
item.description:
Pedestrian crossing light has been knocked out of alignment and isn't visible easily from opposite pavement. Vehicle lights have also been knocked out of position and are at an angle to the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lewisham High Street, Ladywell, Lewisham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Urgent Safety Hazard: Damaged Metal Box with Live Cables at Street Lamp, 2nd July
item.description:
I am writing to report a serious safety hazard in our neighborhood. There is a metal box containing live electrical cables for a street lamp located at [exact location or address]. The box is damaged and is easily accessible to the public, including children. This poses a significant risk of electrical shock or injury to anyone who might come into contact with it. Immediate attention and repair are urgently needed to prevent potential accidents.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Queen's Walk, Southwark, London
Report on FixMyStreet
